channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: I spent $200 on my friend’s birthday party and she didn’t thank me. Is it rude to ask her to reimburse me for half?
item.description: ”I told her that she was treating me like a party planner — and not like a friend.”

item.title: Bitcoin has moved back above $90,000. Why this strategist says a return to $100,000 is not far away
item.description: BTIG’s chief technical strategist Jonathan Krinksy said bitcoin has just exited seasonal period of bottoming.

item.title: Midterm elections are coming in 2026. Here’s what 100 years of data tell us about how stocks may react.
item.description: The ‘midterm curse’ means its likely the ruling party will fare badly

item.title: CME halts futures trading on stocks, currencies and other markets, citing data center cooling issue
item.description: Black Friday trading was off to an auspicious start after exchange operator CME was forced to halt futures trading on Friday.

item.title: ‘We’re struggling’: I’m 41 with 5 kids and $46K in credit-card debt. Do I raid my $1.2 million IRAs to pay it off?
item.description: “I bring in $7,200 a month from my pension and disability benefits.”

item.title: Bank of America expects a meager gain for stocks next year
item.description: The bank expects the broad index to rise around 5% in 2026.

item.title: These stocks are outperforming this year and are cheap heading into 2026
item.description: There are a host of companies that have rallied this year and are well-loved by analysts, but still remain strong buying opportunities for investors.

item.title: This gold miner ETF can give a blueprint on whether the health care rally can go on. Here's why
item.description: Frank Cappelleri looks at the charts on the XLV ETF and at another fund that can help investors assess where health care will go.

item.title: Tired of politics? Here are some controversial stocks to argue about over Thanksgiving dinner
item.description: CNBC Pro screened the S&P 1500 index for those large- and midcap securities that are the most divisive on Wall Street.

item.title: Why the pressure on bitcoin may linger into year-end
item.description: A bitcoin sell-off driven by investors that bought BTC at a premium will likely put pressure on the asset through the year's end, according to Compass...
